title: Authors and Citation
text: Vincent Guillemot. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jelizarow M, Guillemot V (2013). SHIP: SHrinkage covariance Incorporating Prior knowledge. R package version 1.0.2, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=SHIP.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SHIP: SHrinkage covariance Incorporating Prior knowledge},   author = {Monika Jelizarow and Vincent Guillemot},   year = {2013},   note = {R package version 1.0.2},   url = {https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=SHIP}, }

title: SHrinkage covariance Incorporating Prior knowledge
text: SHIP package implements shrinkage estimator covariance matrix given covariance target, described Schaefer Strimmer 2005. addition, proposes several targets based biological knowledge extracted public database KEGG. use shrinkage estimator, one just hand data set form n × p matrix, covariance target. one wishes use proposed targets, data set compatible KEGG, .e. possible extract gene pathways belongs . information, example, can found libraries hgu133plus2.db. ## Installation can install development version SHIP GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("vguillemot/SHIP")

what: SHrinkage covariance Incorporating Prior knowledge — SHIP
title: SHrinkage covariance Incorporating Prior knowledge — SHIP
text: SHIP-package implements shrinkage estimator covariance matrix given covariance target, described Schaefer Strimmer 2005.  addition, proposes several targets based biological knowledge extracted public database KEGG.

title: SHrinkage covariance Incorporating Prior knowledge — SHIP
text: use shrinkage estimator, one just hand data set form \(n \times p\) matrix, covariance target. one wishes use proposed targets, data set compatible KEGG, .e. possible extract gene pathways belongs .  information, example, can found libraries hgu133plus2.db.

title: SHrinkage covariance Incorporating Prior knowledge — SHIP
text: J. Schaefer K. Strimmer, 2005. shrinkage approach large-scale covariance matrix estimation implications functional genomics.  Statist. Appl. Genet. Mol. Biol. 4:32. M. Jelizarow, V. Guillemot, . Tenenhaus, K. Strimmer, .-L. Boulesteix, 2010. -optimism bioinformatics: illustration. Bioinformatics. Accepted.

title: SHrinkage covariance Incorporating Prior knowledge — SHIP
text: Monika Jelizarow Vincent Guillemot

title: SHrinkage covariance Incorporating Prior knowledge — SHIP
code: # A short example on a toy dataset # require(SHIP)  data(expl) attach(expl)  sig1 <- shrink.estim(x,targetD(x)) #> Error in shrink.estim(x, targetD(x)): could not find function "shrink.estim" sig2 <- shrink.estim(x,targetF(x)) #> Error in shrink.estim(x, targetF(x)): could not find function "shrink.estim" sig3 <- shrink.estim(x,targetCor(x,genegroups)) #> Error in shrink.estim(x, targetCor(x, genegroups)): could not find function "shrink.estim" sig4 <- shrink.estim(x,targetG(x,genegroups)) #> Error in shrink.estim(x, targetG(x, genegroups)): could not find function "shrink.estim"  paste(sig1[[2]],collapse=" ") #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'sig1' not found paste(sig2[[2]],collapse=" ") #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'sig2' not found paste(sig3[[2]],collapse=" ") #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'sig3' not found paste(sig4[[2]],collapse=" ") #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'sig4' not found  if (FALSE) { # Example on how to get the gene groups lists require(hgu95av2.db) # e.g. we have some interesting gene names : vec <- c("MYC","ID2","PTGER4","ATF4","FGFR1","MET","HLA-DRB6") # we then want to convert them into Probe Sets symb <- as.list(hgu95av2SYMBOL) pbsets <- names(symb[unlist(sapply(vec,function(x,l) which(l==x)[1],symb))]) # Probe Sets which are themselves converted into a gene groups list genegroups <- as.list(hgu95av2PATH)[pbsets] }

what: Creating a covariance target, optionally by using information from KEGG pathways. — build.target
title: Creating a covariance target, optionally by using information from KEGG pathways. — build.target
text: function build.target() wrapper function build various types covariance targets (D,F,G,Gpos,Gstar,cor).

title: Creating a covariance target, optionally by using information from KEGG pathways. — build.target
code: build.target(x, genegroups = NULL, type)

title: Creating a covariance target, optionally by using information from KEGG pathways. — build.target
text: x \(n \times p\) matrix. genegroups List groups gene belongs : entry list dedicated gene (identified way x). item list thus vector pathway IDs. type Character string specifying wished target: "D" diagonal target, "cor" correlation target, "G", "Gpos" "Gstar" G-type target (see Jelizarow et al, 2010) "F" F-target.

title: Creating a covariance target, optionally by using information from KEGG pathways. — build.target
text: \(p \times p\) target covariance matrix certain type.

title: Creating a covariance target, optionally by using information from KEGG pathways. — build.target
text: M. Jelizarow, V. Guillemot, . Tenenhaus, K. Strimmer, .-L. Boulesteix, 2010.  -optimism bioinformatics: illustration. Bioinformatics. Accepted.

title: Creating a covariance target, optionally by using information from KEGG pathways. — build.target
text: Vincent Guillemot

title: Creating a covariance target, optionally by using information from KEGG pathways. — build.target
code: # Simulate dataset x <- matrix(rnorm(20*30),20,30) # Try different targets build.target(x,type="D") #> Error in build.target(x, type = "D"): could not find function "build.target"

what: Check if two genes belong to any common KEGG pathway. — check.path
title: Check if two genes belong to any common KEGG pathway. — check.path
text: Takes arguments two vectors IDs test whether common ID.

title: Check if two genes belong to any common KEGG pathway. — check.path
code: check.path(p1, p2)

title: Check if two genes belong to any common KEGG pathway. — check.path
text: p1 Vector pathways gene 1 belongs . p2 Vector pathways gene 2 belongs .

title: Check if two genes belong to any common KEGG pathway. — check.path
text: Return 0 two genes belong common pathway, return 1 otherwise.  internal function used function target.help.

title: Check if two genes belong to any common KEGG pathway. — check.path
text: Monika Jelizarow Vincent Guillemot

title: Check if two genes belong to any common KEGG pathway. — check.path
code: g1 <- c("path1","path2","path3","path4") g2 <- c("path5","path6","path3","path11") g3 <- c("path10","path5","path12","path13") check.path(g1,g2) # 1 #> Error in check.path(g1, g2): could not find function "check.path" check.path(g1,g3) # 0 #> Error in check.path(g1, g3): could not find function "check.path"

what: Small example extracted from a microarray data set. — expl
title: Small example extracted from a microarray data set. — expl
text: microarray data set study prostate cancer Singh et al. collection microarray hgu95av2, gene groups thus given information hgu95av2.db Bioconductor library (see Carslon et al.).

title: Small example extracted from a microarray data set. — expl
text: M. Carlson, S. Falcon, H. Pages, N. Li. hgu95av2.db: Affymetrix Human Genome U95 Set annotation data (chip hgu95av2).  R package version 2.2.12. D. Singh, P. G. Febbo, K. Ross, D. G. Jackson, J. Manola, C. Ladd, P. Tamayo, . . Renshaw, . V. D'Amico, J. P. Richie, E. S. Lander, M. Loda, P. W. Kantoff, T. R. Golub, W. R. Sellers, 2002. Gene expression correlates clinical prostate cancer behavior.  Cancer Cell, Department Adult Oncology, Brigham Women's Hospital, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA 02115, USA., 1, 203-209.

title: Small example extracted from a microarray data set. — expl
text: dataset list containing: \(102 \times 100\) matrix \(x\) 100 genes randomly chosen data set Singh et al., list genegroups containing 100 vectors KEGG pathway IDs (gene belongs ).

title: Small example extracted from a microarray data set. — expl
code: data(expl) dim(expl$x) #> [1] 102 100 length(expl$genegroups) #> [1] 100

what: Transform a list of Pathway IDs into a binary matrix. — target.help
title: Transform a list of Pathway IDs into a binary matrix. — target.help
text: function internal function used transform given list \(p\) (one vector pathway IDs per gene) groups binary matrix.

title: Transform a list of Pathway IDs into a binary matrix. — target.help
code: target.help(genes)

title: Transform a list of Pathway IDs into a binary matrix. — target.help
text: genes List \(p\) items. item vector Pathway IDs gene belongs .

title: Transform a list of Pathway IDs into a binary matrix. — target.help
text: \(p \times p\) binary matrix: coefficient (,j) 1 genes j belong common pathway 0 otherwise. internal function called example targetG.

title: Transform a list of Pathway IDs into a binary matrix. — target.help
text: Monika Jelizarow Vincent Guillemot

title: Transform a list of Pathway IDs into a binary matrix. — target.help
code: g1 <- c("path1","path2","path3","path4") g2 <- c("path5","path6","path3","path11") g3 <- c("path10","path5","path12","path13") target.help(list(g1,g2,g3))  #> Error in target.help(list(g1, g2, g3)): could not find function "target.help"

what: Computation of the target Cor. — targetCor
title: Computation of the target Cor. — targetCor
text: \(p \times p\) target Cor computed \(n \times p\) data matrix. modified version target G. particular, tests correlations (significance level 0.05) sets non-significant correlations zero mean correlation \(\bar{r}\) computed.

title: Computation of the target Cor. — targetCor
code: targetCor(x, genegroups)

title: Computation of the target Cor. — targetCor
text: x \(n \times p\) data matrix. genegroups list genes obtained using database KEGG, entry list pathway names genes belongs . gene belong gene functional group, entry NA.

title: Computation of the target Cor. — targetCor
text: \(p \times p\) matrix.

title: Computation of the target Cor. — targetCor
text: J. Schaefer K. Strimmer, 2005. shrinkage approach large-scale covariance matrix estimation implications functional genomics.  Statist. Appl. Genet. Mol. Biol. 4:32.

title: Computation of the target Cor. — targetCor
text: Monika Jelizarow Vincent Guillemot

title: Computation of the target Cor. — targetCor
code: # A short example on a toy dataset # require(SHIP) data(expl) attach(expl) #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 3): #>  #>     genegroups, x tar <- targetCor(x,genegroups) #> Error in targetCor(x, genegroups): could not find function "targetCor" which(tar[upper.tri(tar)]!=0) # not many non zero coefficients ! #> Error in as.vector(x, mode): cannot coerce type 'closure' to vector of type 'any'

what: Computation of the diagonal target D ('diagonal, unequal variances'). — targetD
title: Computation of the diagonal target D ('diagonal, unequal variances'). — targetD
text: \(p \times p\) diagonal target D computed \(n \times p\) data matrix. defined follows (\(,j = 1,...,p\)): $$t_{ij}=\left\{ $$$$\begin {array} {ll} $$$$s_{ii}\;&\mbox{}\;=j\\ $$$$0\;&\mbox{}\;\neq j\\ $$$$\end {array} $$$$\right.$$ \(s_{ij}\) denotes entry unbiased covariance matrix row \(\), column \(j\).

title: Computation of the diagonal target D ('diagonal, unequal variances'). — targetD
code: targetD(x, genegroups)

title: Computation of the diagonal target D ('diagonal, unequal variances'). — targetD
text: x \(n \times p\) data matrix. genegroups genegroups used target.

title: Computation of the diagonal target D ('diagonal, unequal variances'). — targetD
text: \(p \times p\) diagonal matrix.

title: Computation of the diagonal target D ('diagonal, unequal variances'). — targetD
text: J. Schaefer K. Strimmer, 2005. shrinkage approach large-scale covariance matrix estimation implications functional genomics.  Statist. Appl. Genet. Mol. Biol. 4:32.

title: Computation of the diagonal target D ('diagonal, unequal variances'). — targetD
text: Monika Jelizarow Vincent Guillemot

title: Computation of the diagonal target D ('diagonal, unequal variances'). — targetD
code: x <- matrix(rnorm(10*30),10,30) tar <- targetD(x,NULL) #> Error in targetD(x, NULL): could not find function "targetD"

what: Computation of target F ('constant correlation model'). — targetF
title: Computation of target F ('constant correlation model'). — targetF
text: \(p \times p\) target F computed \(n \times p\) data matrix. defined follows (\(,j = 1,...,p\)): $$t_{ij}=\left\{ $$$$\begin {array} {ll} $$$$s_{ii}\;&\mbox{}\;=j\\ $$$$\bar{r}\sqrt{s_{ii}s_{jj}}\;&\mbox{}\;\neq j\\ $$$$\end {array} $$$$\right.$$ \(\bar{r}\) average sample correlations \(s_{ij}\) denotes entry unbiased covariance matrix row \(\), column \(j\).

title: Computation of target F ('constant correlation model'). — targetF
code: targetF(x, genegroups)

title: Computation of target F ('constant correlation model'). — targetF
text: x \(n \times p\) data matrix. genegroups genegroups used target.

title: Computation of target F ('constant correlation model'). — targetF
text: \(p \times p\) matrix.

title: Computation of target F ('constant correlation model'). — targetF
text: J. Schaefer K. Strimmer, 2005. shrinkage approach large-scale covariance matrix estimation implications functional genomics.  Statist. Appl. Genet. Mol. Biol. 4:32.

title: Computation of target F ('constant correlation model'). — targetF
text: Monika Jelizarow Vincent Guillemot

title: Computation of target F ('constant correlation model'). — targetF
code: # A short example on a toy dataset # require(SHIP) data(expl) attach(expl) #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 3): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 4): #>  #>     genegroups, x tar <- targetF(x,NULL) #> Error in targetF(x, NULL): could not find function "targetF" which(tar[upper.tri(tar)]!=0) # many non zero coefficients ! #> Error in as.vector(x, mode): cannot coerce type 'closure' to vector of type 'any'

what: Computation of target G ('knowledge-based constant correlation model'). — targetG
title: Computation of target G ('knowledge-based constant correlation model'). — targetG
text: \(p \times p\) target G computed \(n \times p\) data matrix. defined follows (\(,j = 1,...,p\)): $$t_{ij}=\left\{ $$$$\begin {array} {ll} $$$$s_{ii}\;&\mbox{}\;=j\\ $$$$\bar{r}\sqrt{s_{ii}s_{jj}}\;&\mbox{}\;\neq j, \sim j\\ $$$$0\;&\mbox{otherwise} $$$$\end{array} $$$$\right.$$ \(\bar{r}\) average sample correlations \(s_{ij}\) denotes entry unbiased covariance matrix row \(\), column \(j\). notation \(\sim j\) means genes \(\) \(j\) connected, .e. genes \(\) \(j\) gene functional group.

title: Computation of target G ('knowledge-based constant correlation model'). — targetG
code: targetG(x, genegroups)

title: Computation of target G ('knowledge-based constant correlation model'). — targetG
text: x \(n \times p\) data matrix. genegroups list genes obtained using database KEGG, entry list pathway names genes belongs . gene belong gene functional group, entry NA.

title: Computation of target G ('knowledge-based constant correlation model'). — targetG
text: \(p \times p\) matrix.

title: Computation of target G ('knowledge-based constant correlation model'). — targetG
text: J. Schaefer K. Strimmer, 2005. shrinkage approach large-scale covariance matrix estimation implications functional genomics.  Statist. Appl. Genet. Mol. Biol. 4:32. M. Jelizarow, V. Guillemot, . Tenenhaus, K. Strimmer, .-L. Boulesteix, 2010. -optimism bioinformatics: illustration. Bioinformatics. Accepted.

title: Computation of target G ('knowledge-based constant correlation model'). — targetG
text: Monika Jelizarow Vincent Guillemot

title: Computation of target G ('knowledge-based constant correlation model'). — targetG
code: # A short example on a toy dataset # require(SHIP) data(expl) attach(expl) #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 3): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 4): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 5): #>  #>     genegroups, x tar <- targetG(x,genegroups) #> Error in targetG(x, genegroups): could not find function "targetG" which(tar[upper.tri(tar)]!=0) # not many non zero coefficients ! #> Error in as.vector(x, mode): cannot coerce type 'closure' to vector of type 'any'

what: Computation of the target Gpos. — targetGpos
title: Computation of the target Gpos. — targetGpos
text: \(p \times p\) target Gpos computed \(n \times p\) data matrix. modified version target G. particular, completely ignores negative correlations computes mean correlation \(\bar{r}\) using positive ones .

title: Computation of the target Gpos. — targetGpos
code: targetGpos(x, genegroups)

title: Computation of the target Gpos. — targetGpos
text: x \(n \times p\) data matrix. genegroups list genes obtained using database KEGG, entry list pathway names genes belongs . gene belong gene functional group, entry NA.

title: Computation of the target Gpos. — targetGpos
text: \(p \times p\) matrix.

title: Computation of the target Gpos. — targetGpos
text: J. Schaefer K. Strimmer, 2005. shrinkage approach large-scale covariance matrix estimation implications functional genomics.  Statist. Appl. Genet. Mol. Biol. 4:32. M. Jelizarow, V. Guillemot, . Tenenhaus, K. Strimmer, .-L. Boulesteix, 2010. -optimism bioinformatics: illustration. Bioinformatics. Accepted.

code: # A short example on a toy dataset # require(SHIP) data(expl) attach(expl) #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 3): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 4): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 5): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 6): #>  #>     genegroups, x tar <- targetGpos(x,genegroups) #> Error in targetGpos(x, genegroups): could not find function "targetGpos" which(tar[upper.tri(tar)]!=0) # not many non zero coefficients ! #> Error in as.vector(x, mode): cannot coerce type 'closure' to vector of type 'any'

what: Computation of the target Gstar. — targetGstar
title: Computation of the target Gstar. — targetGstar
text: \(p \times p\) target Gstar computed \(n \times p\) data matrix. modified version target G. particular, involves two parameters correlation (positive negative one) instead single parameter \(\bar{r}\) order account negatively correlated genes within pathway

title: Computation of the target Gstar. — targetGstar
code: targetGstar(x, genegroups)

text: x \(n \times p\) data matrix. genegroups list genes obtained using database KEGG, entry list pathway names genes belongs . gene belong gene functional group, entry NA.

code: # A short example on a toy dataset # require(SHIP) data(expl) attach(expl) #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 3): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 4): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 5): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 6): #>  #>     genegroups, x #> The following objects are masked from expl (pos = 7): #>  #>     genegroups, x tar <- targetGstar(x,genegroups) #> Error in targetGstar(x, genegroups): could not find function "targetGstar" which(tar[upper.tri(tar)]!=0) # not many non zero coefficients ! #> Error in as.vector(x, mode): cannot coerce type 'closure' to vector of type 'any'
